DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Umbilical Cord Blood Type Negation National Marrow Donor Program Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to a non-NMDP cord blood unit.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Umbilical Cord Blood Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Negation National Marrow Donor Program Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Negation National Marrow Donor Program Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
